oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Country Music Awards Highlights - Steve Snell - 1971 - KEEN
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of a 1971 Country Music Awards and 46th Anniversary of the Grand Ole Opry highlights program on radio station KEEN (San Jose, Calif.) with Steve Snell (host).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening statements for highlights from Snell's trip to the 1971 CMAs and 46th anniversary of the GOO (Steve Snell) -- (00:43) I Beg Your Pardon, I Never Promised You A Rose Garden (Lynn Anderson) [recorded excerpt] -- (03:25) Snell recalls Johnny Cash taking the stage -- (03:35) Man In Black (Johnny Cash) [recorded excerpt] -- (06:23) Snell talks about Cash's record sales that year, and talks about seeing Marty Robbins -- (06:50) My Woman, My Woman, My Wife (Marty Robbins) [recorded excerpt] -- (10:15) Snell talks about Robbins, and recalls visiting the Country Music Hall of Fame while in Nashville -- (10:32) Hank Williams' Guitar (Freddie Hart) [recorded excerpt] -- (14:20) Snells talks about Freddie Hart, and various artifacts he saw at the Hall -- Snells talks about meeting Art Satherly -- (14:43) Snell talks about seeing Tammy Wynette -- (14:52) Stand By Your Man (Tammy Wynette) [recorded excerpt] -- (17:23) Snell talks about his favorite part of the convention, at the Capitol Records show, when Freddie Hart performed Easy Lovin' -- (17:53) Easy Lovin' (Freddie Hart) [recorded excerpt] -- (20:18) Snell talks about Hart receiving multiple standing ovations, openly crying on stage in appreciation -- (20:50) Closing statements (Steve Snell)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Country Music Association (U.S)--Awards; Grand Ole Opry House (Nashville, Tenn.);
